description: The infrastructure manager queries for any assets running unsupported operating system versions; the assistant retrieves inventory, identifies out‑of‑support OSes, and provides upgrade guide links.

messages.content: You are DisasterShield Planner, an AI‑driven disaster recovery assistant. Use the provided tools to gather inventory, backup schedules, and threat intel, then synthesize risk scores, runbooks and reports. Respond in clear, concise language suitable for IT managers.
Hi, can you tell me if any of our assets are running unsupported operating system versions? I'd like a list of those assets and links to the appropriate upgrade guides.

Sure, I’ll pull the current inventory for all production services and filter for operating systems that are no longer supported.

Executing `get_inventory`...

[
  {
    "asset_id": "srv-001",
    "service": "CustomerPortal",
    "location": "us-east-1",
    "os": "Windows Server 2008",
    "os_version": "2008 R2",
    "criticality": "high"
  },
  {
    "asset_id": "srv-002",
    "service": "PaymentsAPI",
    "location": "us-west-2",
    "os": "Ubuntu",
    "os_version": "14.04",
    "criticality": "high"
  },
  {
    "asset_id": "vm-015",
    "service": "AnalyticsEngine",
    "location": "eu-central-1",
    "os": "CentOS",
    "os_version": "7.2",
    "criticality": "medium"
  },
  {
    "asset_id": "db-023",
    "service": "CustomerDB",
    "location": "us-east-1",
    "os": "Red Hat Enterprise Linux",
    "os_version": "6.9",
    "criticality": "high"
  },
  {
    "asset_id": "srv-010",
    "service": "LegacyReporting",
    "location": "ap-south-1",
    "os": "Windows Server 2012",
    "os_version": "2012 R2",
    "criticality": "low"
  }
]

Here are the assets that are running operating system versions that are **no longer supported** by the vendor (EOL dates passed):

| Asset ID | Service | Location | OS | Version | Criticality | Upgrade Guide |
|----------|---------|----------|----|---------|-------------|---------------|
| srv-001 | CustomerPortal | us-east-1 | Windows Server | 2008 R2 | high | <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/get-started/windows-server-2008-r2-end-of-support> |
| srv-002 | PaymentsAPI | us-west-2 | Ubuntu | 14.04 LTS | high | <https://ubuntu.com/security/end-of-life> |
| db-023 | CustomerDB | us-east-1 | Red Hat Enterprise Linux | 6.9 | high | <https://access.redhat.com/articles/3078> |
| srv-010 | LegacyReporting | ap-south-1 | Windows Server | 2012 R2 | low | <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/get-started/windows-server-2012-r2-end-of-support> |

**Notes**
- CentOS 7.2 (vm-015) is still within its maintenance window, but you may want to plan an upgrade to CentOS Stream 9 or migrate to AlmaLinux/Rocky Linux.
- For each asset, the upgrade guide links direct you to the vendor’s official migration path and recommended tools.

Would you like me to generate a remediation runbook for these assets or schedule a report to be sent to the stakeholders?
